intro: Isocarpha tricephala, commonly known as the three-headed wormwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. Isocarpha tricephala is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
